articles.title: New long-necked dinosaur helps rewrite evolutionary history of sauropods in South America - University of Michigan News
articles.description:
Panoramic view of the Serranía del Perijá in Colombia, where a vertebra was found in 1943. The vertebra has allowed for scientists to identify a new species of sauropod, the Perijasaurus lapaz. Image credit: Jeff Wilson Mantilla, University of Michigan

articles.title: Ending HIV in America | NOVA - PBS
articles.description: Science has made extraordinary progress against HIV. Can innovative drugs and therapies finally end it?
